contentList.content: A resource used by Gunslingers to fuel special abilities.
Number of Shots remaining before you need to reload your main firearm.
Number of Shots remaining before you need to reload your off-hand firearm.
You can now dual reload for 1 Ka. You also automatically reload your firearm(s) after leaving combat.
You are proficient with using firearms.
Counters the spell being cast and deafens the target for 2 turns.
Ranged shot that targets enemies who harm your companions.
You should never try to flee from a Gunslinger
The target is deafened, stopping spellcasting that requires verbal components.
Reloads your main and off hand guns.
Does weapon damage and the target will be banished for 2 turns.
The target is banished for 2 turns.
When you make ranged weapon attacks within melee range, the <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> do not have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

Your agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain spells.

When a spell or effect would deal half damage on a successful Dexterity Saving Throw, it deals no damage if you succeed, and only half damage if you fail.
On Damage Rolls, roll twice and use the higher result.
You gain a +2 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">ranged weapon attacks</LSTag>.
Switches between the Colt Navy and Army models.

Descended from the Knightly order of Arthur Eld, these warriors defend all that is good.

The Gunslinger Litany
I do not aim with my hand.
He who aims with his hand has forgotten the face of his father.
I aim with my eye.
I do not shoot with my hand.
He who shoots with his hand has forgotten the face of his father.
I shoot with my mind.
I do not kill with my gun.
He who kills with his gun has forgotten the face of his father.
I kill with my heart.
A precise shot that causes weapon damage and slows your target.
Your knowledge allows you to strike with surgical accuracy to target a vital artery which causes weapon damage and bleeds your target.
If the target is both bleeding and slowed you do extra damage and knock your target prone.
You take a moment to center yourself and restore your Ka.
You inspire with your words, giving yourself and your companions advantage for 1 turn.
You radiate an aura the inspires your companions. Enemies have Disadvantage on Opportunity Attacks against you and your companions, the number needed to roll a Critical Hit is reduced by 1.
Your weapon deals an additional [1], increased by [2] when attacking fiends or undead.
Contains a basic quality set of tools that includes a cleaning rod, brushes, a cleaning swab, oils, and rags to keep your firearm in working order.
Contains a high quality set of tools that includes a cleaning rod, jags, patches, brushes, chemicals, a cleaning swab, oils, and rags to keep your firearm in excellent working order.

A used weapon that hasn't been maintained well.
You should look around for some maintenance tools.

A clean and well maintained weapon.
You should look around for better quality maintenance tools.

An immaculately maintained weapon.
With some specialized tools you could probably remake this into something special.

In the hands of an expert Gunslinger, this weapon is nearly perfect.
You wonder if there are any better to be found.
This is the weapon of a master Gunslinger.
A small forge with tools that will enable you to break down your existing gun to create something new.

Your attacks are infused with extra force.

Ranged weapon attacks deal an additional [1].

Your bullet fires forward in a [1] long line. Each creature in that line must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or take weapon damage plus an extra [2] piercing damage.
Fire [1] shots at targets of your choice. Dealing weapon damage to each target.
These Gunslingers follow a darker path. They have forsaken their oaths and dabble in necromancy and other foul arts.
Shoot [2] magical darts, each dealing [1]. They always hit their target.
<LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_TurnUndead">Turn</LSTag> an undead creature, it also takes [1].
This shot heals up to two undead allies 25% of their max HP.
You channel your song and your willpower into a powerful shot that heals an ally for 33% of their max HP, this will even bring a dead compantion back to life.
Spells you cast ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Necrotic damage. In addition, when you deal Necrotic damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.
Ok, it's just three necrotic graveyard rats. But they believe they are a swarm. Please support their choices.
A beam of necrotic moonlight strikes the target and other nearby units. Leaves behind frozen ground.

The Gunbreaker is a mysterious nomadic warrior. This subclass is a defensive high mobility skirmisher that focuses on controlling and harassing enemies. With a wide variety of ammo types, the Gunbreaker has a shot for every occasion.
Fires an electrified tether and pulls in an enemy within 9m of your position. Compels the enemy to attack you for two turns.
As a reaction you fire an electrified tether and pull in an enemy who attacks one of your companions within 9m of your position. Compels the enemy to attack you instead for two turns.
Counters the spell being cast and deafens the target for 2 turns.
The first strike in the Gunbreaker combo chain.
The second strike in the Gunbreaker combo chain.
The final strike in the Gunbreaker combo chain.
Leap up to 9m to a target location, if you target an enemy unit you will also do damage and knock the target <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">prone</LSTag>.
Fires a fragmentation grenade that causes explosive damage in a 4m radius on impact.
Fires a flame granade that causes fire damage in a 4m radius on impact. This attack will cause your weapon to overheat.
Fires a canister of grease that spreads in a 4m radius on impact.
This attack will cause your weapon to overheat and if overheat convergence is activated it will deal bonus damage.
Rallies the targeted ally, grants temporary hit points and encloses them in a protective sphere for two turns.
A close range cone attack that can hit and possibly daze multiple targets.
Fires a net that entangles an enemy for 2 turns. If successful, it cannot be used again on the same enemy for 4 turns.
Number of Shots remaining before you need to reload your Gunblade.
Number of Shots remaining before you need to reload your off-hand Gunblade.
Engulfed by a vengeful fire. Takes [1] each turn, but can use <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="MAG_Fire_Heat_Convergence_Passive">Overheat Convergence</LSTag>.

The next time you deal Fire damage, it deals an additional [1] for every turn of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_FIRE_HEAT">Overheat</LSTag> affecting you. All stacks of overheat will be removed after the attack.
Consume your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_FIRE_HEAT">Overheat</LSTag> to fuel a powerful attack.

The next time you deal Fire damage, it deals an additional [1] for every turn of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_FIRE_HEAT">Overheat</LSTag> affecting you. All stacks of overheat will be removed after the attack.
A cone of flame erupts from your blade doing fire damage and burning all in the area of effect.
Whenever you inflict <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag>, you gain 1 turn of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_FIRE_HEAT">Overheat</LSTag>.
Whenever you deal Fire damage, you gain 2 turns of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MAG_FIRE_HEAT">Overheat</LSTag>.
Gunjitsu: The Way of the Gun
The Gunjitsu practicioner practices subterfuge and specializes in dispatching enemies quickly and quietly.
This is my rifle, there are many like it but this one is mine.
The Gunzerker wades into battle bringing fury and chaos.
The Gun Mage uses their Ka to imbue their weapons with devastating effects.
The Gun Saint uses their Ka to heal and support their friends while controlling and debilitating their enemies.
A large two handed sword with gun parts attached to it.
Deal [1] extra die of damage on <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">critical hits</LSTag> with ranged weapons.
Deal [1] extra dice of damage on <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">critical hits</LSTag> with ranged weapons.
The Ka within the affected entity is resonating. Use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_KaResonation_Blast">Ka Resonation: Blast</LSTag> to make it explode.
Shoot a creature with a Ka imbued shot, making the Ka in its body <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KA_RESONATION">Resonate</LSTag> with yours.
You can then make the Ka explode with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_KaResonation_Blast">Ka Resonation: Blast</LSTag>.
Detonate the Ka of a creature <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KA_RESONATION">Resonating</LSTag> with you, hitting the creature and any non-allied entities within [1] of it.
The resulting explosion causes any nearby creatures Resonating with you to also detonate.
You are immune to the effects of lethargy after haste expires.
At the start of combat you regenerate 4 Ka.

You can use your action to spend 4 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Ka">Ka Points</LSTag> to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> for 10 turns. During that time, you also have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistance">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage but force damage.
You become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> and gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistance">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage but force damage.
This entity is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistant</LSTag> to all damage except force damage.
The weapon's enchantment level increases progressively by +[1] at levels [2], [3] and [4] of your character.
This is the preferred weapon of a practicioner of the Way of the Gun
You have bonded with your firearm(s). You can now imbue your abilities upon them. You also cannot be disarmed.
When you would normally roll one or more dice to restore <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> with a spell, you instead use the highest number possible for each die.
You improve your firearm imbue speed. You cast your imbue cantrips and spells with no action requirements.
Imbue your firearm with Acid Splash.
Imbue your firearm with Bone Chill.
Imbue your firearm with Acid Chromatic Orb.
Imbue your firearm with Fire Chromatic Orb.
Imbue your firearm with Cold Chromatic Orb.
Imbue your firearm with Lightning Chromatic Orb.
Imbue your firearm with Poison Chromatic Orb.
Imbue your firearm with Thunder Chromatic Orb.
Imbue your firearm with Eldritch Blast.
Imbue your firearm with Fire Bolt.
Imbue your firearm with Poison Spray.
Imbue your firearm with Ray of Frost.
Imbue your firearm with Sacred Flame.
Imbue your firearm with Shocking Grasp.
Imbue your firearm with Vicious Mockery.
Imbue your firearm with Burning Hands.
Imbue your firearm with Magic Missile.
Imbue your firearm with Witch Bolt.
Imbue your firearm with Color Spray.
Imbue your firearm with Ray of Sickness.
Imbue your firearm with Ice Knife.
Imbue your firearm with Crown Of Madness.
Imbue your firearm with the Reduce effect.
Imbue your firearm with Phantasmal Force.
Imbue your firearm with Scorching Ray.
Imbue your firearm with Hypnotic Pattern.
Imbue your firearm with Lightning Bolt.
Imbue your firearm with Sleet Storm.
Imbue your firearm with Ice Storm.
Imbue your firearm with Wall of Fire.
Imbue your firearm with Cone of Cold.
Imbue your firearm with Insect Plague.
Imbue your firearm with Cure Wounds.
Imbue your firearm with Guiding Bolt.
Imbue your firearm with Inflict Wounds.
Imbue your firearm with Strength Curse.
Imbue your firearm with Dexterity Curse.
Imbue your firearm with Constitution Curse.
Imbue your firearm with Intelligence Curse.
Imbue your firearm with Wisdom Curse.
Imbue your firearm with Charisma Curse.
Imbue your firearm with Attack Curse.
Imbue your firearm with Extra Damage Curse.
Imbue your firearm with Skip Turn Curse.
Imbue your firearm with Flame Strike.
Imbue your firearm with Charm Person.
Imbue your firearm with Stinking Cloud.
Imbue your firearm with Hold Monster.
Imbue your firearm with Planar Binding.
Imbue your firearm with Blade Barrier.
Imbue your firearm with Chain Lightning.
Imbue your firearm with Circle Of Death.
First comes smiles, then lies. Last is gunfire.
First comes smiles, then lies. Last is gunfire.
If you are a Dirge, Mage, or Saint you use your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting Ability Modifier</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
A quick roundhouse kick to knock your enemy back.
Drops a smoke bomb at your feet which turns you invisible for 3 turns and makes a small fog cloud to obscure enemy sight for 2 turns.
All enemies within 3m take 1d4 fire damage per turn.

You are engulfed by a vengeful fire that does not harm you. Enemies within 2m take [1] each turn. You can use <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="MAG_Fire_Heat_Convergence_Passive">Overheat Convergence</LSTag>.
Deal [1] extra damage with melee and improvised weapons, and throwing. Your body becomes superheated. When your rage ends all unused stacks of overheat are discarded.
Engulfed by a vengeful fire, all enemies within 3m take 1d4 fire damage per turn. You can use <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="MAG_Fire_Heat_Convergence_Passive">Overheat Convergence</LSTag>.

Fires a red hot high velocity round in a [1] long line. Each creature in that line must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> to avoid taking full damage.
A short range fire cone attack.
Your abilities ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to fire damage. In addition, when you deal Fire damage, you cannot roll a 1.

Superheated air collects under you, buoying you high into the sky before you plummet back down in a fiery comet. You Fly 15 feet straight up into the air, then Fly in a straight line to an empty space of your choice on the ground within 60 feet. When you land, the blistering air blasts out from you, dealing [1] and [2] to all creatures within 3m.

Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> turns into a frenzy! You gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FrenziedStrike">Frenzied Strike</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Throw_FrenziedThrow">Enraged Throw</LSTag>. You can also make an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Throw_ImprovisedWeaponBerserker">Improvised Weapon Attack</LSTag> as a bonus action. When your rage ends all unused stacks of overheat are discarded.
A shot range necrotic cone attack.

Fires a necrotic high velocity round in a [1] long line. Each creature in that line must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> to avoid taking full damage.
You channel your willpower into a powerful shot that heals an ally for 33% of their max HP, this will even bring a dead companion back to life.

You can increase the power of your simpler spells. When you cast a spell of 1st through 5th level that deals damage, you can deal maximum damage with that spell. The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a long rest, you take [1] for each level of the spell, immediately after you cast it. You take an additional [2] per spell level with each subsequent cast.
You are able to see <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> creatures up to [1] distance.

You are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> against you while you aren't <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INCAPACITATED">Incapacitated</LSTag>.
Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> is so fierce that it ends early only if you fall <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="UNCONSCIOUS">Unconscious</LSTag> or if you choose to end it.
When you make a Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, you can roll twice and use the higher result.
Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.
This shot will heal allies, the healing scales with your level.
A single solid slug, an alternative to the normal cone fire pattern. Does damage to a single target.
A regular cone type spray pattern attack. Does 1/2 damage to all enemies in the cone.
An attack that teleports you to three different targets and does a close ranged attack on each one.
This weapon sheathes in the default back location.
This weapon sheathes at the hip.
This weapon can only be wielded by a Dirge, the attack rolls use Charisma.
This weapon can only be wielded by a Gun Mage, the attack rolls use Intelligence.
This weapon can only be wielded by a Gun Saint, the attack rolls use Wisdom.
This weapon can only be wielded by a Gunslinger.
Way of the Gun Armory Chest
Summons a chest containing level scaling weapon(s) for your Gunslinger subclass.
A chest containing level scaling weapon(s) for your Gunslinger subclass.
The chest and all its contents will disappear after 5 turns.
Your experience in battle has made you better able to maintain your concentration under most circumstances. You get <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on concentration saving throws.
Born to lose. Live to win.

The Deadeye is a master of subterfuge and long distance highly accurate and damaging shots. When the Deadeye is flanked they have several ways of getting out of a bad situation and back to shooting from range.
Your sniper weapon attacks deal an additional [1] damage when the target is farther away than [2] meters.
Your sniper weapon attacks are at disadvantage and deal half damage when your target is closer than 6m. You are unable to use the sniper gun at all while flanked.
Attack and blind an enemy within 1.5m for 2 turns.
Mark a creature as your quarry to deal an additional [1] whenever you hit it with a weapon attack.

Has Disadvantage on Attack Rolls. Range of attacks and spells reduced to [1].

Attack Rolls against Blinded creatures have Advantage.
Can use a free action to reapply Deadeye's Mark to another target.
Shift your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DEADEYES_MARK">Deadeye's Mark</LSTag> to a new creature as a free action.
Spend 3 Ka to deal an extra [1] damage.
Spend one Ka to give your target disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks until the end of it's next turn.
Target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn.
Spend 1 Ka to retaliate when a creature misses you with a melee attack. Damage equal to a roll of your Ka die plus your Dexterity modifier.
When a melee attack hits you, spend 3 Ka to increase your AC by 3 until the beginning of your next turn. If your new AC would cause the attack to miss then it misses.
Spend one Ka to kick an attacking enemy and push them back 5 feet.

When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can spend 2 Ka to Shadow Step as a free action into an area of shadows in an unoccupied space that you can see, you can also Umbral Cloak as a free action once you arrive there.
When you shoot a target at close range, you can spend one Ka to make a melee attack against it as a free action.
Spend 1 Ka to react to your attacker by returning fire.

Unlocks both Umbral Shroud and Shadow Step as free actions. After using Shadow Step you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next ranged <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.
